New York: Wiley, 2002.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780471320579&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9788126518944&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;javascript:togglePreview(&#039;9788126518944&#039;);&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;University Physics, Revised Ed, Harris Benson, Wiley-India, 2008&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9788126518944&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot; src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books/api.js?key=notsupplied&amp;amp;v=0&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780495113690&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Serway, Raymond et.al. College Physics. Australia: Thomson Brooks/Cole, 2006.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780495113690&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;4&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;IIT-JEE  Physics- S.P.Arya, MTG Books, 2007&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;5&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Electric  circuits- David A.Bell, Oxford University press,  Seventh Edition 2009&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;       &lt;!--\r\n&lt;body onUnload=&quot;checkEmbeddability();&quot; &gt;\r\n&lt;/body&gt;\r\n--&gt;       &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;!--\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Reference:&lt;/strong&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;br  /&gt;\r\n&lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;ol&gt;\r\n    &lt;ol&gt;\r\n        &lt;ul&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;Physics  &amp;ndash; David Halliday, Robert Resnick, Kenneth S Krane, Vol. II, 5th (e),  Willey Student Edition, 2002&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;University  Physics.- Harris, Benson, Willey Student Edition, 2004&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;College  Physics Raymond A Serway, Jerry S. Faughn,Chris Vuille, Charles A Bennett,  Vol.II, Thomson Brooks/Cole, 2006&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;IIT-JEE  Physics- S.P.Arya, MTG Books, 2007&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;Electric  circuits- David A.Bell, Oxford University press, Seventh Edition 2009&lt;/li&gt;\r\n        &lt;/ul&gt;\r\n        &lt;/blockquote&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        --&gt;       &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Webliography:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n        &lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; \t    1.\tModified Nodal Analysis. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LU_decomposition&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LU_decomposition&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; ]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        3.\tGraph theory. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;/blockquote&gt;\r\n        &lt;div class=&quot;postConentPadding&quot;&gt;\r\n        &lt;link type=&quot;text/css&quot; rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; href=&quot;http://sakshat.amrita.ac.in/VirtualLab/css/default.css&quot; /&gt;&lt;style type=&quot;text/css&quot;&gt;&lt;/style&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;  &lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;\r\n        &lt;div style=&quot;padding-left: 50px;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Experiment Mapping &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;\r\n        &lt;table width=&quot;85%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;caption class=&quot;tableHeading&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/caption&gt;\r\n            &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                &lt;tr class=&quot;tagExpHead&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Subject&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Courses&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;34%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Level&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;tr class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td colspan=&quot;3&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Electrostatics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Quantitative Circuit Analysis&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;IIT Bombay&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- B Tech All Branches&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- M Sc Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Under Graduate (UG)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;/table&gt;\r\n        &lt;/div&gt;\r\n        &lt;/div&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(365,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;When a train of waves strikes an obstruction, the pattern of transmitted energy produces a characteristic interference or diffraction pattern beyond the object. \t  &lt;strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nSingle slit diffraction&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;277&quot; width=&quot;311&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image1.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;When waves pass through a gap which is about as wide as the wavelength they spread out into the region beyond the gap. Huygens considered each point along a wave front to be the source of a secondary disturbance which forms a semi-circular wavelet. Diffraction is due to the superposition of such secondary wavelets. The secondary wavelets spread out and overlap each other interfering with each other to form a pattern of maximum and minimum intensity. The pattern formed on a screen consists of a broad central band of light with dark bands on either side. The dark bands are caused when the light from the top half of the slit destructively interferes with the light from the bottom half.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;332&quot; width=&quot;584&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image2.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;350&quot; width=&quot;521&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image3.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Consider a slit of width &amp;lsquo;a&amp;rsquo;. At an angle &amp;theta; the path difference between the top and bottom of the slit is one wavelength. This leads to destructive interference because the path difference between the top and middle of the slit is half a wavelength. In fact at this angle all the light in the top half of the slit will cancel with the light from the bottom half to produce a dark band.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;25&quot; width=&quot;113&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image4.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Minima in the intensity occur if this path length difference is an integer number of wavelengths.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;25&quot; width=&quot;101&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/draw5.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;where&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;148&quot; width=&quot;429&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/draw6.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Intensity as a function of angle &amp;theta; is given by&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;486&quot; width=&quot;662&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/draw7.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;center&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Intensity as a function of angle &amp;theta; is given by&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;center&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;185&quot; width=&quot;817&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/draw8.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;center&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The factor 4 arises from the fact that the amplitude of the wave is twice what it would be if one slit were covered. The &amp;ldquo;diffraction&amp;rdquo; term in double slit formula above is recognizable as the intensity distribution for a single slit and serves as the envelope for the &amp;ldquo;interference&amp;rdquo; term which describes the interference between the diffracted beams from each slit. \t  &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For an array of slits, positions of the minima and maxima are not changed, the fringes visible on a screen however do become sharper, as can be seen in the image.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;116&quot; width=&quot;259&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/draw9.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2-slit and 5-slit diffraction of red laser light&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Diffraction at N &amp;ndash; slit:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In the case of N slits of width &amp;lsquo;a&amp;rsquo; whose centers are separated by a distance &amp;lsquo;d&amp;rsquo;, the diffraction pattern that arises can be shown to be determined by&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;46&quot; width=&quot;179&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/theory_clip_image002(1).gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;256&quot; width=&quot;631&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/draw10.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;328&quot; width=&quot;569&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/draw11.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(366,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Performing the Simulation&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe simulation virtualizes the N-slit diffraction experiment. The user can view the intensity patterns of diffraction taking place at single slit, double slit, N slits etc. Select any one wavelength of light.&amp;nbsp; Changing the aperture size and number of slits different intensity patterns are seen.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nLight source, slits, Screen (Black background).&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;nbsp; &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Help&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/u&gt;Variable  Region&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1. Wavelength slider helps you to choose the wavelength needed for the  simulation to be performed.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2. Aperture Slider: The slider helps to change the aperture size of the slits.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n3. The No of slits slider helps to change the no of slits used.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Measurement Region &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe variation in the intensities can be seen when aperture size or no of slits is changed. The intensity variation graph also given changes with the change in aperture size or no of slits Angular positions for the first three orders of diffraction on either sides of central maxima for the single slit diffraction is given. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(370,'&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Books&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; style=&quot;padding-left: 50px;&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780748744473&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Bonnett, Raymond. Vibrations and Waves. Boca Raton: CRC Press, 1971.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780748744473&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780486658186&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;javascript:togglePreview(&#039;9780486658186&#039;);&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Towne, Dudley. Wave Phenomena. Mineola: Dover, 1988.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780486658186&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot; src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books/api.js?key=notsupplied&amp;amp;v=0&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; \t    &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Webliography&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://micro.magnet.fsu.edu/primer/java/diffraction/basicdiffraction/index.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://micro.magnet.fsu.edu/primer/java/diffraction/basicdiffraction/index.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://www.otagophysics.ac.nz/Physics100/simulations/Gamelan/java/slitdiffr/index.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://www.otagophysics.ac.nz/Physics100/simulations/Gamelan/java/slitdiffr/index.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://micro.magnet.fsu.edu/primer/java/diffraction/diffractionorders/index.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://micro.magnet.fsu.edu/primer/java/diffraction/diffractionorders/index.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://eosweb.larc.nasa.gov/EDDOCS/Wavelengths_for_Colors.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://eosweb.larc.nasa.gov/EDDOCS/Wavelengths_for_Colors.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Video References&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-2966627536591956617&amp;amp;hl=en#&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-2966627536591956617&amp;amp;hl=en#&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(288,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In electrical circuit theory, Thevenin&amp;rsquo;s theorem for linear electrical networks states that any combination of voltage sources, current sources and resistors with two terminals is electrically equivalent to a single voltage source V and a single series resistor R. For single frequency AC systems the theorem can also be applied to general impedances, not just resistors.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTo calculate the equivalent circuit, one needs a resistance and some voltage - two unknowns. And so, one needs two equations. These two equations are usually obtained by using the following steps, but any conditions one places on the terminals of the circuit should also work:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; 1. Calculate the output voltage, VAB, when in open circuit condition (no load resistor - meaning infinite resistance). This is VTh.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2. Calculate the output current, IAB, when the output terminals are short circuited (load resistance is 0). RTh equals VTh divided by this IAB.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;bull;\tThe equivalent circuit is a voltage source with voltage VTh in series with a resistance RTh.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nStep 2 could also be thought of like this:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2a. Now replace voltage sources with short circuits and current sources with open circuits.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2b. Replace the load circuit with an imaginary ohm meter and measure the total resistance, R, &amp;quot;looking back&amp;quot; into the circuit. This is RTh.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe Thevenin-equivalent voltage is the voltage at the output terminals of the original circuit. When calculating a Th&amp;eacute;venin-equivalent voltage, the voltage divider principle is often useful, by declaring one terminal to be Vout and the other terminal to be at the ground point.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;1&quot; border=&quot;1&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; width=&quot;200&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;136&quot; width=&quot;152&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image001(3).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;138&quot; width=&quot;158&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image002(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;138&quot; width=&quot;149&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image003(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The Thevenin-equivalent resistance is the resistance measured across points A and B &amp;quot;looking back&amp;quot; into the circuit. It is important to first replace all voltage- and current-sources with their internal resistances. For an ideal voltage source, this means replace the voltage source with a short circuit. For an ideal current source, this means replace the current source with an open circuit. Resistance can then be calculated across the terminals using the formulae for series and parallel circuits.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Example 1:-&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nFor example,  consider the following circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;187&quot; width=&quot;362&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image004(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Firstly, we have to remove the centre 40&amp;Omega; resistor and short out (not physically as this would be dangerous) all the emf&amp;acute;s connected to the circuit, or open circuit any current sources. The value of resistor Rs is found by calculating the total resistance at the terminals A and B with all the emf&amp;acute;s removed, and the value of the voltage required Vs is the total voltage across terminals A and B with an open circuit and no load resistor Rs connected. Then, we get the following circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;207&quot; width=&quot;307&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image005(1).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Find the Equivalent Resistance (Rs)&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;94&quot; width=&quot;418&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image006(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Find the Equivalent Voltage (Vs)&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;187&quot; width=&quot;362&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image007(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;We now need to reconnect the two voltages back into the circuit, and as VS&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;=&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;VAB the current flowing around the loop is calculated as:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;62&quot; width=&quot;274&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image008(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;So the voltage  drop across the 20&amp;Omega; resistor can be calculated as:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nVAB&amp;nbsp;=&amp;nbsp;20&amp;nbsp;-&amp;nbsp;(20&amp;Omega;&amp;nbsp;x&amp;nbsp;0.33amps)&amp;nbsp;=&amp;nbsp;  &amp;nbsp;13.33&amp;nbsp;volts.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThen the Thevenin&amp;rsquo;s  Equivalent circuit is shown below with the 40&amp;Omega; resistor connected.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;212&quot; width=&quot;299&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image009(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;And from this  the current flowing in the circuit is given as:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;65&quot; width=&quot;297&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image010(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Thevenin&amp;rsquo;s theorem can be used as a circuit analysis method and is particularly useful if the load is to take a series of different values. It is not as powerful as Mesh or Nodal analysis in larger networks because the use of Mesh or Nodal analysis is usually necessary in any Thevenin exercise, so it might well to be used from the start. However, Thevenin&amp;rsquo;s equivalent circuits of Transistors, Voltage&lt;strong&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;Sources such as batteries etc, are very useful in  circuit design.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nVerification of Thevnin&amp;rsquo;s  Theorem using the simulator,&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Step1:-  Create the actual circuit and measure the current across the load points&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;233&quot; width=&quot;195&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image011(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Step 2:- Create the Thevnin&amp;rsquo;s equivalent circuit by first creating the equivalent voltage source and equivalent resistance and then measue the current across the load using an ammeter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;232&quot; width=&quot;217&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image012(3).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In both the cases the current measured across  the resistnace should be of the same value.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(289,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tResistor:&lt;/strong&gt; A resistor is a two-terminal electronic component that produces a voltage across its terminals that is proportional to the electric current through it in accordance with Ohm&#039;s law.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tLamp:&lt;/strong&gt; A lamp is a replaceable component such as an incandescent light bulb, which is designed to produce light from electricity. These components usually have a base of ceramic, metal, glass or plastic, which makes an electrical connection in the socket of a light fixture.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tWire:&lt;/strong&gt; A wire is a single, usually cylindrical, elongated string of metal. Wires are used to bear mechanical loads and to carry electricity and telecommunications signals. Wire is commonly formed by drawing the metal through a hole in a die or draw plate.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tSwitch:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a switch is an electrical component that can break an electrical circuit, interrupting the current or diverting it from one conductor to another.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tBattery:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a battery or voltaic cell is a combination of many electrochemical Galvanic cells of identical type to store chemical energy and to deliver higher voltage or higher current than with single cells.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tVoltmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit. Analog voltmeters move a pointer across a scale in proportion to the voltage of the circuit; digital voltmeters give a numerical display of voltage by use of an analog to digital converter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tAmmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; An ammeter is a measuring instrument used to measure the electric current in a circuit. Electric currents are measured in amperes (A), hence the name.&#039;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tNon-contact ammeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A type of ammeter that need not be a part of the circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;     &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(293,'&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Reference:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;           &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; class=&quot;content&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780471320579&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Resnick, Robert et.al. Physics. New York: Wiley, 2002.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780471320579&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9788126518944&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;javascript:togglePreview(&#039;9788126518944&#039;);&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;University Physics, Revised Ed, Harris Benson, Wiley-India, 2008&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9788126518944&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot; src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books/api.js?key=notsupplied&amp;amp;v=0&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780495113690&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Serway, Raymond et.al. Faughn,Chris Vuille, Charles A Bennett,  Vol.II, Thomson Brooks/Cole, 2006&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;IIT-JEE  Physics- S.P.Arya, MTG Books, 2007&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;Electric  circuits- David A.Bell, Oxford University press, Seventh Edition 2009&lt;/li&gt;\r\n        &lt;/ul&gt;\r\n        &lt;/p&gt;\r\n        --&gt; \t         &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Webliography:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n        &lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; 1.\tModified Nodal Analysis. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;/blockquote&gt;\r\n        &lt;div class=&quot;postConentPadding&quot;&gt;\r\n        &lt;link type=&quot;text/css&quot; rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; href=&quot;http://sakshat.amrita.ac.in/VirtualLab/css/default.css&quot; /&gt;&lt;style type=&quot;text/css&quot;&gt;&lt;/style&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;  &lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;\r\n        &lt;div style=&quot;padding-left: 50px;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Experiment Mapping &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;\r\n        &lt;table width=&quot;85%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;caption class=&quot;tableHeading&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/caption&gt;\r\n            &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                &lt;tr class=&quot;tagExpHead&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Subject&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Courses&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;34%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Level&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;tr class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td colspan=&quot;3&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Electrostatics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Quantitative Circuit Analysis&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;IIT Bombay&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- B Tech All Branches&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- M Sc Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Under Graduate (UG)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;/table&gt;\r\n        &lt;/div&gt;\r\n        &lt;/div&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(295,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Ohm&#039;s law applies to electrical circuits; it states that the current through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the potential difference or voltage across the two points, and inversely proportional to the resistance between them. The mathematical equation that describes this relationship is:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;45&quot; width=&quot;60&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0001.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Example&lt;/strong&gt;:-&lt;br /&gt;\r\nA nine volt battery supplies power to a cordless curling iron with a resistance of 18 ohms. How much current is flowing through the curling iron?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Sketch:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;134&quot; width=&quot;491&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0002.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Solution:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;32&quot; width=&quot;97&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0003.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1) Since  V(Voltage) and R(Resistance) are known, solve for I(Current) by dividing both  sides of the equation by R.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;57&quot; width=&quot;97&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0004.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2) The R&#039;s on  the right hand side of the equation cancel. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;62&quot; width=&quot;97&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0005.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;3) I is then  left in terms of V and R. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;57&quot; width=&quot;61&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0006.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;  &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;4) Substitute  in the values for V(Voltage) and R(Resistance). &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;57&quot; width=&quot;70&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0007.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;5) Solve for  I(Current). &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;32&quot; width=&quot;160&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0008.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Using the Simulator you can verify the voltage and current by first creating the above circuit and measuring the current and voltage using voltmeter and ammeter respectively.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;249&quot; width=&quot;333&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0009.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(296,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tResistor:&lt;/strong&gt; A resistor is a two-terminal electronic component that produces a voltage across its terminals that is proportional to the electric current through it in accordance with Ohm&#039;s law.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tLamp:&lt;/strong&gt; A lamp is a replaceable component such as an incandescent light bulb, which is designed to produce light from electricity. These components usually have a base of ceramic, metal, glass or plastic, which makes an electrical connection in the socket of a light fixture.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tWire:&lt;/strong&gt; A wire is a single, usually cylindrical, elongated string of metal. Wires are used to bear mechanical loads and to carry electricity and telecommunications signals. Wire is commonly formed by drawing the metal through a hole in a die or draw plate.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tSwitch:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a switch is an electrical component that can break an electrical circuit, interrupting the current or diverting it from one conductor to another.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tBattery:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a battery or voltaic cell is a combination of many electrochemical Galvanic cells of identical type to store chemical energy and to deliver higher voltage or higher current than with single cells.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tVoltmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit. Analog voltmeters move a pointer across a scale in proportion to the voltage of the circuit; digital voltmeters give a numerical display of voltage by use of an analog to digital converter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tAmmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; An ammeter is a measuring instrument used to measure the electric current in a circuit. Electric currents are measured in amperes (A), hence the name.&#039;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tNon-contact ammeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A type of ammeter that need not be a part of the circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;     &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(300,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;For more info on DC circuits one may read books, visit labs or check for other web contents. Here are some choices for reading material.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Reference:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;       &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; class=&quot;content&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780891001218&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Rosen, Stan. D. C. Circuits. Riverton: Aviation Maintenance Publishers, 1980.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780891001218&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Robert C. Carter, Introduction to electrical circuit analysis, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1966.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;       &lt;!--\r\n&lt;body onUnload=&quot;checkEmbeddability();&quot; &gt;\r\n&lt;/body&gt;\r\n--&gt;       &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Webliography:/p&amp;gt;        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; 1.\tModified Nodal Analysis. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://www.swarthmore.edu/NatSci/echeeve1/Ref/mna/MNA1.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://www.swarthmore.edu/NatSci/echeeve1/Ref/mna/MNA1.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; ]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2.\tMatrix operations. rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; href=&quot;http://sakshat.amrita.ac.in/VirtualLab/css/default.css&quot; /&gt;&lt;style type=&quot;text/css&quot;&gt;&lt;/style&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;
