&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/caption&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;tagExpHead&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Subject&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Courses&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;34%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Level&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td colspan=&quot;3&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Electrostatics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Quantitative Circuit Analysis&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;IIT Bombay&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- B Tech All Branches&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- M Sc Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Under Graduate (UG)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;/div&gt;\r\n&lt;/div&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(372,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Objectives&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;85%&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;56%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;\r\n            &lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1)\tTo revise the concept of interference of light waves in general and thin-film interference in particular.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            2)\tTo set up and observe Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            3) To determine the radius of curvature of one surface of a lens by measuring the size of Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings and analyzing the result.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            4)\tTo analyze prints of the photographs of rings with different liquids of different refractive indices. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Thin film  interference&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;A film is said to be thin when its thickness is about the order of one wavelength of visible light which is taken to be 550 nm.&amp;nbsp; When light is incident on such a film, a small portion gets reflected from the upper surface and a major portion is transmitted into the film.&amp;nbsp;Again a small part of the transmitted component is reflected&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;45%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;273&quot; width=&quot;388&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/NRings.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;back into the film by the lower surface and the rest of it emerges out of the film. These reflected beams reunite to produce interference.&amp;nbsp; Also the transmitted beams too interfere.&amp;nbsp; This type of interference taking place in thin films is called &lt;strong&gt;interference by division of amplitude&lt;/strong&gt;.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;img height=&quot;578&quot; width=&quot;522&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image001.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In the above figure the rays r&lt;sub&gt;12&lt;/sub&gt;  and t&lt;sub&gt;21&lt;/sub&gt;   interfere and results in a constructive or destructive interference depending  on their path differences given as&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;28&quot; width=&quot;210&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image003.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;strong&gt;constructive  interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;159&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image005.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;destructive  interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Where &lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;34&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image007.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt; refractive index of medium 2 and&amp;nbsp;&lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;100&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image009.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;the order of interference&amp;nbsp;  \t  &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The transmitted light from t&lt;sub&gt;23&lt;/sub&gt; can also interfere and  result in constructive or destructive interference. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Thin film interference with  films of varying thickness (Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings):&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Rings are fringes of equal thickness.&amp;nbsp; They are observed when light is reflected from a plano-convex lens of a long focal length placed in contact with a plane glass plate.&amp;nbsp; A thin air film is formed between the plate and the lens.&amp;nbsp; The thickness of the air film varies from zero at the point of contact to some value t.&amp;nbsp; If the lens plate system is illuminated with monochromatic light falling on it normally, concentric bright and dark interference rings are observed in reflected light.&amp;nbsp; These circular fringes were discovered by Newton and are called Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;262&quot; width=&quot;405&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/theory_clip_image001(2).gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;A ray AB incident normally on the system gets partially reflected at the bottom curved surface of the lens (ray 1) and part of the transmitted ray is partially reflected (ray 2) from the top surface of the plane glass plate.&amp;nbsp; The rays 1 and 2 are derived from the same incident ray by division of amplitude and therefore are coherent.&amp;nbsp; Ray 2 undergoes a phase change of p upon reflection since it is reflected from air-to-glass boundary.&amp;nbsp; &lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe condition for  constructive and destructive interferences are given as&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Where, for normal incidence, &amp;nbsp;&lt;strong&gt;cos r =  1&lt;/strong&gt; and for air film &lt;img height=&quot;10&quot; width=&quot;9&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/u-horizontal.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt; &lt;strong&gt;= 1&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;28&quot; width=&quot;130&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image012.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;constructive  interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;82&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image014.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;destructive interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(1)\t&lt;strong&gt;Central dark spot &lt;/strong&gt;: At the point of contact of the lens with the glass plate the thickness of the air film is very small compared to the wavelength of light therefore the path difference introduced between the interfering waves is zero. Consequently, the interfering waves at the centre are opposite in phase and interfere destructively. Thus a dark spot is produced.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; \t  &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(2) &lt;strong&gt;Circular fringes with equal thickness&lt;/strong&gt;: Each maximum or minimum is a locus of constant film thickness. Since the locus of points having the same thickness fall on a circle having its centre at the point of contact, the fringes are circular.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; \t &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(3)&lt;strong&gt;\tFringes are localized&lt;/strong&gt;: Though the system is illuminated with a parallel beam of light, the reflected rays are not parallel. They interfere nearer to the top surface of the air film and appear to diverge from there when viewed from the top. The fringes are seen near the upper surface of the film and hence are said to be localized in the film.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n(4)&lt;strong&gt; Radii of the m&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;dark rings&lt;/strong&gt;: &lt;img height=&quot;22&quot; width=&quot;94&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image016(1).png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(5)&lt;strong&gt;Radii of the mth bright ring&lt;/strong&gt; : &lt;img height=&quot;38&quot; width=&quot;139&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image018.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(6) The radius of a dark ring is proportional to the radius of curvature of the lens by the relation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;22&quot; width=&quot;59&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image020.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;7) Rings get closer as the order increases (m increases) since the diameter does not increase in the same proportion. \t  &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(8) In transmitted light the ring system is exactly complementary to the reflected ring system so that the centre spot is bright.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(9) Under white light we get coloured fringes.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(10) The wavelength of monochromatic light can be determined as &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;41&quot; width=&quot;108&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image022.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;where,&amp;nbsp; D &lt;sub&gt;m+p&lt;/sub&gt;is the diameter of the (m+p)&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;   dark ring&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;D&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;/sub&gt;is the diameter of the m&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;dark ring&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(11) If the air film is substituted by the liquid film, then the refractive index of the liquid is given by&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;53&quot; width=&quot;196&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image024.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(373,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Performing the Simulation&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe simulation virtualizes the Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings experiment. The user can view the effect of Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings formed when the medium changes. Select any one type of medium.&amp;nbsp; Changing the radius of Curvature of the lens and Wavelength of light used different ring patterns are seen.&amp;nbsp; &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nStart  button, Light source, Filter, Microscope, Lens, Medium, Glass plate&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Help&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/u&gt;Variable  Region&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n1. Choose Medium Combo box helps you to choose the type of medium that the  simulation have to perform.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2. Radius Slider The slider is fixes helps to change the radius of curvature of  lens.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n3. The wavelength slider helps to change the wavelength of light used.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Measurement Region &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1. The start button will help play the  simulation.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2.The variation in the rings can be  seen when change of medium, radius and wavelength       &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(377,'&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Books&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; class=&quot;content&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780495386933&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;javascript:togglePreview(&#039;9780495386933&#039;);&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Serway, Raymond et.al.         &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Webliography&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(302,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In electronics, components of an electronic circuit can be connected in series or in parallel. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;266&quot; width=&quot;336&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image001(4).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Components connected in series are connected along a single path, so the same current flows through all of the components. Components connected in parallel are connected so the same voltage is applied to each component.       &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nA circuit composed solely of components connected in series is known as a series circuit; likewise, one connected completely in parallel is known as a parallel circuit.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Example 1:- &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nWe have a series circuit like this. What is the total voltage, resistance and current?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;139&quot; width=&quot;298&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image002(3).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;First, we have to find out the total voltage using equation 1 above, and then resistance using equation for resistance in series, and finally you can find out the current using equation ohm&amp;rsquo;s law.        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTotal voltage is&amp;nbsp; 30 V &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTotal resistance is 30 + 10 + 40 + 20 = 100 ohm&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nUsing ohm&#039;s law, I = V / R, then we can find  out the total current. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nI = 30 / 100 = 0.3 A&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Verify this using the simulator by  constructing the above series circuit and measuring the voltage, resistance and  current.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;308&quot; width=&quot;330&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image003(3).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Example 2:- &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIf you have a parallel circuit like this, what is the total resistance and voltage? And voltage and current on A, B, and C?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;158&quot; width=&quot;229&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image004(3).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In order to find out the total voltage, we have to find out the total resistance. Using equation for resistance in parallel, we can find out the total resistance.        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n1/R = 1/15 + 1/15 + 1/30 = 5/30, R = 6 ohm&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThen using ohm&#039;s law,V = I R, we can find out the total current. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nI= 30 / 6 = 5 A&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nWe now know the voltage on A, B, and C, which is 30 V each. Using ohm&#039;s law again, we can find out the current on A, B, and C. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIA = 30/15 = 2 A,&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIB = 30/15 = 2 A,&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIC = 30/30 = 1 A .&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nWhen you add up all the current we get 5 A which is the total current. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nVerify this using the simulator by constructing the above series circuit and measuring the voltage, resistance and current.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;303&quot; width=&quot;319&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image005(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(386,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;A ferromagnet has a spontaneous magnetic moment.&amp;nbsp; The atoms (or molecules) of ferromagnetic materials have a net intrinsic magnetic dipole moment which is primarily due to the spin of electrons.&amp;nbsp; The interaction, called as spin exchange interaction, between the neighboring atomic magnetic dipoles is very strong and exists even in the absence of an external magnetic field.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Magnetization could be explained based on Domain theory.&amp;nbsp; Weiss postulated the existence of domains within the ferromagnetic material.&amp;nbsp; Within these domains the material is magnetized to saturation but the direction of magnetization differs from domain to domain, resulting in a zero resultant magnetization of the specimen.&amp;nbsp; The process of magnetization consists in rotating the different domains in direction of applied external field so that the specimen exhibits a net magnetization externally.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;248&quot; width=&quot;300&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image001.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;250&quot; width=&quot;305&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image002(1).png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The Barkhausen effect is indirect evidence for the existence of magnetic domains within ferromagnetic materials. When domains grow, under an applied magnetic field, the movement of the domain walls occurs by discontinuous and abrupt Barkhausen jumps.&amp;nbsp; The jumps in magnetization of a ferromagnetic material can induce a voltage in a winding that in turn can produce Barkhausen noise. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In the Barkhausen effect, a large coil of fine wire is connected through an amplifier to a speaker. When an iron rod is placed within the coil and stroked with a magnet, an audible roaring sound will be produced from the sudden realignments of the magnetic domains within the rod.&amp;nbsp; Due to electromagnetic induction, the shifting of a domain creates a change in the magnetic field around the iron, and that changing magnetic field induces a current in the surrounding coil detectable by the amplifier.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;The  simulation objective&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;Demonstration  of Barkhausen effect&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(303,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tResistor:&lt;/strong&gt; A resistor is a two-terminal electronic component that produces a voltage across its terminals that is proportional to the electric current through it in accordance with Ohm&#039;s law.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tLamp:&lt;/strong&gt; A lamp is a replaceable component such as an incandescent light bulb, which is designed to produce light from electricity. These components usually have a base of ceramic, metal, glass or plastic, which makes an electrical connection in the socket of a light fixture.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tWire:&lt;/strong&gt; A wire is a single, usually cylindrical, elongated string of metal. Wires are used to bear mechanical loads and to carry electricity and telecommunications signals. Wire is commonly formed by drawing the metal through a hole in a die or draw plate.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tSwitch:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a switch is an electrical component that can break an electrical circuit, interrupting the current or diverting it from one conductor to another.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tBattery:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a battery or voltaic cell is a combination of many electrochemical Galvanic cells of identical type to store chemical energy and to deliver higher voltage or higher current than with single cells.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tVoltmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit. Analog voltmeters move a pointer across a scale in proportion to the voltage of the circuit; digital voltmeters give a numerical display of voltage by use of an analog to digital converter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tAmmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; An ammeter is a measuring instrument used to measure the electric current in a circuit. Electric currents are measured in amperes (A), hence the name.&#039;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tNon-contact ammeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A type of ammeter that need not be a part of the circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(387,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Performing the simulation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe user has the privilege to move the magnet round the stage according to the magnetic movement the rod gets magnetize and the sound produced can be heard.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Help&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Variable Region &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.  Radio Button&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;a.Ferromagnetic material&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;By selecting this radio button a ferromagnetic rod will be shown. The magnetization effect only happens with ferromagnetic materials.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;b.Non Ferromagnetic material&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;By selecting this radio button a non ferromagnetic rod will be shown. The magnetization effect will not happen with a ferromagnetic &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;material&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Measurement Region &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n1. The show rod check box will enable and disable the rod inside the coil. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;      &lt;br /&gt;\r\n2. The show Graph check box enables the amplified output graph.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(307,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;For more info on DC circuits one may read books, visit labs or check for other web contents.
