href=&quot;http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kUbsUGjRlTk&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kUbsUGjRlTk&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Experiment Mapping &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table width=&quot;85%&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;tagExpHead&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Subject&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Courses&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;34%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Level&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td colspan=&quot;3&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Mechanics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Collision&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Under Graduate (UG)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(470,'&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;What is A.C. Sonometer?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;An A.C sonometer is an apparatus by which the transverse vibrations of \t\t\tstrings can be studied. It consists of two bridges, near the ends, one \t\thorse shoe magnet at the middle and at one end is a pulley. A string, \t\toften a copper wire, is fastened at one end, run over the bridges and \t\tthe pulley, and attached to a weight holder hanging below the pulley. \t\tWeights can be added to the holder to produce tension in the wire, and \t\tthe bridges can be moved to change the length of the vibrating section \t\tof the string. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Theory            &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Every object has a natural frequency of vibration. If kinetic energy is applied to an object at a rate that matches its natural frequency, resonance occurs and the object vibrates. In this experiment a small current, produced by a signal generator, causes the sonometer wire to move up and down due to interaction with the magnetic field of a U-shaped magnet. When the rate of movement due to the current matches the fundamental frequency of the wire, resonance occurs causing noticeable vibration.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTo determine the frequency of a string first place a copper string. Connect with an A.C power supply. Then adjust the knife edges or the magnet to get the maximum vibration. This will be the frequency of the stretched string. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; To determine the frequency of a string first place a copper string. Connect with an A.C power supply. Then adjust the knife edges or the magnet to get the maximum vibration. This will be the frequency of the stretched string. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Frequency of vibration of a stretched string       &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;183&quot; width=&quot;309&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image1.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The frequency is calculated using the equation &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;49&quot; width=&quot;85&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image2.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;------Equation(1)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;L = resonating length&lt;br /&gt;\r\nT = tension at the string&lt;br /&gt;\r\nm = mass/unit length of the wire. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Derivation of the equation:-              &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;     Laws of transverse vibrations of stretched strings&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;43&quot; width=&quot;131&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image3.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;43&quot; width=&quot;159&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image4.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;45&quot; width=&quot;75&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image5.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;49&quot; width=&quot;85&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image6.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Law of length&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;For a given string under constant tension, the frequency of vibration is inversely proportional to the length of the string.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;48&quot; width=&quot;80&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image7.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Law of tension&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;          For a given string of constant length, the frequency of vibration is directly proportional to the square root of the tension.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;35&quot; width=&quot;104&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image8.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Law of mass&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;For a string of constant length and under a constant tension, the frequency of vibration is inversely proportional to the square root of its mass per unit length. If M is the mass and L is the length of the string, then&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;45&quot; width=&quot;207&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image9.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;45&quot; width=&quot;191&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image10.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;25&quot; width=&quot;81&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image11.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;If d is the diameter of the wire, then&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;48&quot; width=&quot;75&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image12.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;51&quot; width=&quot;89&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image13.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Substituting in equation (1), we get&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;73&quot; width=&quot;124&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image14.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;51&quot; width=&quot;89&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image15.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The law of mass may be put into two additional laws, for strings of circular cross-section, as given below.                   &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Law of diameter&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;            For a string of a given material and length and under a constant tension, the frequency is inversely proportional to its diameter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;42&quot; width=&quot;77&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image16.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Law of density&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;For a string of a given length and diameter and under constant tension, the frequency is inversely proportional to the square root of the density of the material of the string.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;50&quot; width=&quot;93&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image17.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(471,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The simulation will start play on the power button click. Now the string starts vibrating. Adjust the knife edges or the magnet to get the maximum vibration. At the maximum vibration the paper rider placed in the string will fall down. Repeat the same for different weight, radius, string material and environment. Using Reset button you can reset the simulation.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; \t       &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Icons&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;                Power On - To start the power supply.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPower Off - To stop the power supply.        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Variable Region&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt; Slider&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Weight Rings - To add/remove weight rings.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nKnife Edge A - To move knife edge A.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nKnife Edge B - To move knife edge A.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nMagnet position - To move magnet &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Combo box&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;         Choose Radius - To set different radius.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nChoose String material - To select different types of wires&lt;br /&gt;\r\nChoose environment - To select different environments&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Measurement Region &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Showing string frequency&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Button &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Reset - To resetting the simulation.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(475,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;For more info on one may read books, visit labs or check for other web contents. Here are some choices for reading material. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Books&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; style=&quot;margin-left: 70px;&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: none;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9788122417487&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;javascript:togglePreview(&#039;9788122417487&#039;);&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Srivastava, Anchal. colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Under Graduate (UG)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;/div&gt;\r\n&lt;/div&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(598,'&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;gsdfsdfsdfsdf&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;sd&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;f&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;sd&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;f&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;sdf&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;sd&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;f&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;sdff&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;s&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(206,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1. &amp;nbsp;Which among the following is not a vector?&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;a.&amp;nbsp;Electric current&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. Force&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. Momentum&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. Acceleration&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;2. The resultant of two vectors is minimum when the angle between them is&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;a. 0&amp;ordm;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. 5&amp;ordm;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. 90&amp;ordm;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. 180&amp;ordm;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;3. The maximum number of rectangular components into which a vector can be resolved in its own plane is&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;a. 1&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. 2&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. 3&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. 4&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;4. The projectile has maximum value of time of flight, when it is projected at an angle of projection&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;a. 0&amp;ordm;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. 5&amp;ordm;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. 90&amp;ordm;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. 180&amp;ordm;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;5. The maximum height reached by a particle is independent of&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;a. Angle of projection&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. Initial velocity&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. Acceleration of the projectile&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. Mass of the projectile&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(213,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1. The time taken by a pendulum to complete one oscillation is called its&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;a. Time period&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. Amplitude&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. Frequency&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. Velocity&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;2. The maximum displacement of the torsion pendulum from its mean position is called&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;a. Time period&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. Amplitude&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. Frequency&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. Velocity&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;3. Which of the following statement is correct&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;a. Up thrust is equal to the weight of the liquid displaced by the body&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. Up thrust = Volume of the body x density of liquid x acceleration due to gravity&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. Up thrust is equal to loss of weight of body in liquid&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. All the above&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;4. The moment of inertia of a disc of mass M and radius R, about an axis passing through its centre and perpendicular to the plane of the disc is&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;a. MR2&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. (1/2)MR2&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. (1/4)MR2&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. (3/4)MR2&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),

	(390,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;1. 	(395,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;1. Both spheres will have the same charge&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;b. Charges on 15 cm sphere will be greater than that on 10 cm sphere.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;c. 	(318,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1. 	(320,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;A  100&amp;micro;H inductor passes a current of 10 mA when its terminal voltage is 6.3 V. The resulting current is&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;a. 5 A&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. 2.5 A&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. 1.25 A&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. 1 A&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;3. 	(423,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;1. Heat &amp;amp; Solder, Cleaning, Tinning, Cleaning&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;4. For soldering more difficult metals which solder is best to use&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;a.&amp;nbsp; Acid-core solder&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;b. Rosin-core solder&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;c. Both (a) and (b)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;d. None&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;5. For Soldering electrical wiring which solder should be used&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;a.&amp;nbsp; Acid-core solder&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;b. Rosin-core solder&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;c. Both (a) and (b)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;d. None&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;6. Diameter of the rosin core solder for soldering electrical wiring should be&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;a. 1/4 inch&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;b. 1/2 inch&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;c. 1 inch&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;d. .032 inch&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;7. Lead-Free Soldering needs a higher temperature, about&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;a. 350 &amp;deg;C to 400 &amp;deg;C&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;b. 250 &amp;deg;C to 400 &amp;deg;C&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;c. 250 &amp;deg;C to 300 &amp;deg;C&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;d. 150 &amp;deg;C to 200 &amp;deg;C&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;8. Lead Based Soldering needs a higher temperature, about&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;a. 350 &amp;deg;C to 400 &amp;deg;C&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;b. 250 &amp;deg;C to 400 &amp;deg;C&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;c. 150 &amp;deg;C to 200 &amp;deg;C&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;d. 50 &amp;deg;C to 100 &amp;deg;C&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
	(367,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1. What is a slit?&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;a. An obstacle&lt;br /&gt;\r\nb. A rectangular opening&lt;br /&gt;\r\nc. A&amp;nbsp; circular hole&lt;br /&gt;\r\nd. All the above&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;2. 	(369,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1. 	(432,''),
	(376,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1. 	(374,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1. Two waves of same frequency and amplitude meet at a point where they are 180o out of phase.&amp;nbsp; Which of the following is correct?&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;a. Their energy at that point disappear and thus the energy of the waves after interference is half that of the original waves.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;4. 	(444,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;1. 	(446,'&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;Assignment Questions&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-size: x-small&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana&quot;&gt;1. /*!40000 ALTER TABLE `avl_content_description` ENABLE KEYS*/;


DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `avl_content_details`;

#
# Table structure for table 'avl_content_details'
#

CREATE TABLE `avl_content_details` (
  `content_id` int(5) unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `content_type_id` int(5) unsigned NOT NULL,
  `experiment_id` int(5) unsigned NOT NULL,
  `external` enum('Y','N') NOT NULL default 'Y',
  PRIMARY KEY  (`content_id`),
  UNIQUE KEY `content_id` (`content_id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM AUTO_INCREMENT=613 DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;



#
# Dumping data for table 'avl_content_details'
#

/*!40000 ALTER TABLE `avl_content_details` DISABLE KEYS*/;

) ENGINE=MyISAM AUTO_INCREMENT=11 DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;
